trans-unit.source: Using the Yammer Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Yammer Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Yammer Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Yammer Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Using the Yammer connector in your logic app
trans-unit.target: Using the Yammer connector in your logic app

trans-unit.source: Connect to Yammer and Post Messages action and a trigger to retrieve new message.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Yammer and Post Messages action and a trigger to retrieve new message.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: Creating an Yammer connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Creating an Yammer connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: To use the Yammer connector, you need to first create an instance of the Yammer connector API app.
trans-unit.target: To use the Yammer connector, you need to first create an instance of the Yammer connector API app.

trans-unit.source: This can be done as follows:
trans-unit.target: This can be done as follows:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Yammer Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Yammer Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Yammer connector as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the Yammer connector as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: **Location** - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: **Subscription** - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: **Resource group** - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: **App Service plan** - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: **App Service plan** - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: **Pricing tier** - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: **Name** - give a name for your Yammer Connector
trans-unit.target: **Name** - give a name for your Yammer Connector

trans-unit.source: Click on Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on Create.

trans-unit.source: A new Yammer Connector is created.
trans-unit.target: A new Yammer Connector is created.

trans-unit.source: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App to use the Yammer connector.
trans-unit.target: Once the API app instance is created, you can create a logic App to use the Yammer connector.

trans-unit.source: Using the Yammer Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Yammer Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Yammer connector as a trigger/action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Yammer connector as a trigger/action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App:

trans-unit.source: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:
trans-unit.target: Open “Triggers and Actions” to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:

trans-unit.source: The Yammer connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side:
trans-unit.target: The Yammer connector would appear in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side:

trans-unit.source: You can drop the Yammer Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “Yammer Connector”.
trans-unit.target: You can drop the Yammer Connector API app into the editor by clicking on the “Yammer Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Authorize button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Authorize button.

trans-unit.source: Provide your Yammer credentials.
trans-unit.target: Provide your Yammer credentials.

trans-unit.source: Click “Allow”:
trans-unit.target: Click “Allow”:

trans-unit.source: You can now use Yammer connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Yammer connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: Use the Yammer connector as a trigger
trans-unit.target: Use the Yammer connector as a trigger

trans-unit.source: You can use the new message retrieved from the Yammer trigger ("New Message") in other actions in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can use the new message retrieved from the Yammer trigger ("New Message") in other actions in the flow.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties of Yammer trigger as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties of Yammer trigger as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Group ID** - The ID of the group from which the new message should be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: **Group ID** - The ID of the group from which the new message should be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: If the Group ID is not provided, the message will be retrieved from the Following Feed.
trans-unit.target: If the Group ID is not provided, the message will be retrieved from the Following Feed.

trans-unit.source: Group ID can be retrieved from the Group URL in Yammer.
trans-unit.target: Group ID can be retrieved from the Group URL in Yammer.

trans-unit.source: Example: Group ID in the following URL is "5453203":
trans-unit.target: Example: Group ID in the following URL is "5453203":

trans-unit.source: https://www.yammer.com/microsoft.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=5453203
trans-unit.target: https://www.yammer.com/microsoft.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=5453203

trans-unit.source: Use the Yammer connector to post a message
trans-unit.target: Use the Yammer connector to post a message

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Yammer connector as an action in your logic apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Yammer connector as an action in your logic apps.

trans-unit.source: First, specify a trigger for your logic app or check 'run this logic manually' (as shown below).
trans-unit.target: First, specify a trigger for your logic app or check 'run this logic manually' (as shown below).

trans-unit.source: Add the yammer connector, authorize as appropriate and choose the "Post Message" action.
trans-unit.target: Add the yammer connector, authorize as appropriate and choose the "Post Message" action.

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Post Message" action as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Post Message" action as follows:

trans-unit.source: **Message Text** - Text content of the message to be posted
trans-unit.target: **Message Text** - Text content of the message to be posted

trans-unit.source: **Group ID** - Specify the ID of the group to which new message should be posted.
trans-unit.target: **Group ID** - Specify the ID of the group to which new message should be posted.

trans-unit.source: If Group ID is not provided the message will be posted to All Company Feed.
trans-unit.target: If Group ID is not provided the message will be posted to All Company Feed.

trans-unit.source: Group ID can be retrieved from the Group URL in Yammer.
trans-unit.target: Group ID can be retrieved from the Group URL in Yammer.

trans-unit.source: Example: Group ID in the following URL is "5453203":
trans-unit.target: Example: Group ID in the following URL is "5453203":

trans-unit.source: https://www.yammer.com/microsoft.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=5453203
trans-unit.target: https://www.yammer.com/microsoft.com/#/threads/inGroup?type=in_group&feedId=5453203

trans-unit.source: **Tag Users** - Array of user network names who needs to be tagged in the message:
trans-unit.target: **Tag Users** - Array of user network names who needs to be tagged in the message:

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
